It was a fine morning when Sakus left his small hut, for a walk. Sakus looked very tired because he haden't got much sleep due to he dreams being full of explosions and bright lights. He blinked in the sunlight as he left the village. Sakus had decided to walk up the hill side and visit his cusion, Makas, working in the Mana factory in the neighboring valley. As he walked up the slope he took in they lush green grass and forests and thought about what a good life he leads. There where bird twittering in the trees, he could here grasshoppers making a 'cricket' sound on the edge of the path. Soon he came to peak of the hill. Sakus stood there shocked for a moment, as he looked into the valley below. The large sliver factory had gone, and in its place black charred land. In a panic Sakus ran down the hill side shouting his brothers name. As he ran he could feel a energy surrounding him, green sparks began to flow at his feet,. Randomness: The Philosophy There are two forces, choice and randomness .Randomness is a force that controls what happens, it causes something to happen for no reason .Choice is the option we decide to take. They are both linked as randomness has the power to mess up what you are doing. For example: if you choose to walk down the street, randomness dictates that something could happen for example you trip over a paving slab, something are more common than others, you are more likely to trip than get hit than be hit by a piano falling from the sky. People cannot change randomness, but they can change the likeliness of something happening at random, this is the power of choice. Randomness can be a force of good as well as bad, things are often discovered at random. Many of the things of this site were discovered at random. Other peoples choices often lead to something that is random happening, for example if someone is walking along a cliff edge it increases the chance of rock breaking off and falling towards you. However things like this mustn't be confused with someone pushing a rock off a cliff towards you, that is a direct result of someone's choice not someone increasing the chance of a random thing happening. You cant predict randomness because it happens at anytime, people predicting hurricanes is merely someone telling people that a random thing is a foot after the randomness has happened. The problem is with this is that people 'abuse' randomness, by choosing to do something them blaming it on chance(randomness). People also 'abuse' randomness by doing something that will increase the chance of something happening so it is so likely that it will almost certainly happen .e.g. Lots of people jump on the edge of a cliff, increasing the chance of bits falling of and hitting you.
